value.name: Inverclyde Historical Society to welcome ex council leader
value.description: INVERCLYDE Historical Society is meeting on Thursday at Lyle Gateway. Former councillor Alan Blair, who served as local authority leader with the Liberal Democrats between 2003 and 2007, a will give a talk entitled Thoughts on Politics. This is a change to the published programme.

value.name: Concern about class sizes over 30 in Lancashire schools amid claim of '£28m cut in spending power'
value.description: Lancashire schools with more than 30 pupils in some of their classes will be unable to reduce the headcount to “acceptable” levels because of insufficient funding, a leading teaching union official has warned.

value.name: Three top Tories set to lose seats as MPs to Labour – including Jacob Rees-Mogg
value.description: A number of well-known Tories are being confronted by a stark reality - and the likes of Jacob Rees-Mogg face a daunting prospect.

value.name: LISTEN: Christine Jardine on Any Questions
value.description: Christine Jardine was on Any Questions last night along with Ann Widdecombe (representing the Reform Party), Thangam Debonnaire and Sir Robert Buckland. She travelled to Bridgwater in Somerset. The first question was on whether we should have closer relations with the EU,

value.name: Deputy Mayor chosen to fight Worcester seat by Lib Dems
value.description: WORCESTER’s deputy Mayor has been revealed as the Liberal Democrats parliamentary candidate for the forthcoming General Election.

value.description: Keir Starmer sought to present the new face of Labour this week, just as divisions came to the fore over what had been his flagship policy

value.name: Budget cuts could see some York libraries forced to close - claim Lib Dems
value.description: SOME of York’s libraries could be at risk of being forced to close if threatened budget cuts go ahead, opposition councillors in York say. The warning comes as the full extent of the cuts being proposed to the budget for Explore York Libraries and Archives becomes clear.

value.name: Remember the rules, liberals: Only the right gets to mock America
value.description: “Take a step back, be honest,” Dimon implored Americans without a hint of self-consciousness, during a Jan. 17 interview with CNBC from the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland. “Trump was kind of right about NATO," he continued, "kind of right about immigration. Tax reform worked.”

value.name: House Republicans target Ilhan Omar
value.description: Follower of Donald Trump and Republican Representative from Georgia, Marjorie Minnesota, moved a censure resolution against Omar, and the Republican Whip in the House, Tom Emmer, demanded an ethics investigation against Omar.

value.description: In what is shaping up to be a three-person contest between President Joe Biden, former President Donald Trump, and independent candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr., the question becomes: Which

value.name: Relationships are good. Marriage is better
value.description: “While good marriages are good, bad marriages can be very, very bad. That’s not to say all bad marriages are violent — they’re not — but we don’t know the individual stories when we look at sterile statistics about who declines to marry when they have a child together or who gets married and splits up. We don’t see the whys behind these decisions.”

value.name: Young Democrats form a PAC to push turnout in 2024, eye Boca Raton Florida House district
value.description: Florida young Democrats are pushing to increase turnout in 2024 among a key voting group. They are taking aim at a Boca Raton Florida House seat.

value.name: 'Mom Squad' focuses on mother/child funding, policies in NYS legislature
value.description: The group is made up of 10 to 15 mothers with young children who are among what Albany veterans say is the largest contingent of young mothers in the State Legislature ever.

value.name: Deputy Mayor chosen to fight Worcester seat by Lib Dems
value.description: WORCESTER’s deputy Mayor has been revealed as the Liberal Democrats parliamentary candidate for the forthcoming General Election.

value.name: The curious codependence of Joe Biden and Donald Trump
value.description: Joe Biden and Donald Trump have found themselves in a strange symbiotic relationship – each needing the other as they make their pitch to Americans to vote for them. As the nation embarks on the longest general election campaign in history – though Republican Nikki Haley and Democrat Dean Phillips have not given up their efforts to dislodge the two de facto nominees – 77-year-old Trump and 81-year-old Biden are using the other to make their case.

value.description: A group of House Democrats urged President Joe Biden on Friday to “refocus” his policy on U.S. liquefied natural gas exports, deepening a growing party divide that has pitted liberal Democrats against some moderates in the party.
